unnormalised: ## Going Viral: Aaj Kal Kya Chal Raha Hai? (Social Media Edition)
normalised: ## Going Viral: Aaj Kal Kya Chal Raha Hai? (Social Media Edition)

unnormalised: Hey everyone, social media ke zamane mein, who *doesn't* dream of going viral, right? But cracking the code to viral content is like finding the perfect golgappa wala in Chandni Chowk – everyone has their favourite, but it's still kinda random!
normalised: Hey everyone, social media ke zamane mein, who does not dream of going viral, right? But cracking the code to viral content is like finding the perfect golgappa wala in Chandni Chowk – everyone has their favourite, but it is still kinda random!

unnormalised: So, what's making waves these days? Let's talk trends. Firstly, short-form video is still king. Think those crazy reels featuring Bollywood songs sped up with some amazing dance steps. Example: Someone's lip-syncing to "Kajra Re" with 10 outfit changes – BOOM, instant virality. Remember that trend back in 2021 where everyone was dancing to 'Bachpan ka Pyar'? That was GOLD.

unnormalised: Secondly, relatable content always wins. Something that makes people say, "Arre yaar, same pinch!" Maybe it's a funny take on dealing with that annoying aunty at a wedding, or a hilarious depiction of surviving a Mumbai local train journey at 09:00 hrs. If it resonates, people will share.

unnormalised: Then there's the influencer game. Collaborations are HUGE. Imagine Bhuvan Bam doing a collab with Prajakta Koli – that's viral potential right there. Brands are also catching on, partnering with smaller, more niche influencers to reach specific audiences. Think a local saree shop in Varanasi working with a fashion blogger – super effective!

unnormalised: Finally, never underestimate the power of nostalgia. Anything that reminds people of their childhood, like old Doordarshan shows or Amar Chitra Katha comics, is bound to get some love. My mom still gets a kick out of seeing retro ads from the 80s - especially the Liril soap ad!

unnormalised: Keep an eye on trending topics, engage with your audience, and most importantly, be authentic! The internet has a good sense of humour, but it can smell a fake faster than you can say "paneer tikka masala". So experiment, have fun, and who knows, maybe your content will be the next big thing! I'm betting on someone recreating the entire Mahabharata on TikTok by 15/08/2024. That would be EPIC. And one last thing – never forget to include your hashtag strategy, folks. #ViralHogaIndia!
